newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish Q1 household spending up 3.36 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Spanish Q1 household spending up 3.36 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Average spending by Spanish families rose 3.36 percent in the first quarter of 1997 versus the year-ago period in current pesetas terms, the National Statistic Institute INE said on Friday.
This compares with 2.48 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996.
From January to March average spending fell 0.32 percent versus the previous quarter.
In real terms average household spending rose 0.80 percent in the quarter, versus a fall of 0.81 percent in the last quarter of 1996 and a total decline of 2.13 percent in 1996.
